props.title: What Are For Loops?
props.prompt: A for loop in Java allows you to repeat a block of code multiple times without writing it over and over. The basic syntax is: for (initialization; condition; increment) { code to repeat }. For example, to print numbers 1 through 5, you'd write: for (int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { System.out.println(i); }. In this module, you'll learn to write, read, and modify for loops to solve real problems.
